definition: to capture/to restrain/to constrain/to adhere rigidly to/inflexible
to mortgage/to pawn/to detain in custody/to escort and protect/(literary) to sign

sentences.english: Police did not contact Patterson to inform her of her husband's detention.
sentences.chinese: 警方一直沒有通知派特森關於吳的拘押狀態。

sentences.english: What is the reason for their detention?
Zeng Lingquan, the man who ran the agency, is now in police custody.
sentences.chinese: 這家機構的負責人曾某現在已經被拘押。

sentences.english: He is accused of fleeing the scene but was taken into custody 10 hours later.
sentences.chinese: 陳家被控逃離事故現場，並在10小時後被拘押。

sentences.english: A third Royal Navy serviceman has been arrested by Hampshire Constabulary and is now in custody.
sentences.chinese: 另一名海軍服務人員被漢普郡警方逮捕，現在拘押中。

sentences.english: The suspect is now in custody and had been charged with attempting to destroy an aircraft.
sentences.chinese: 嫌疑人已被拘押，並受到炸機未遂指控。

sentences.english: He was detained for highballing his car after drinking.
sentences.chinese: 他因酒後高速駕車而被拘押。

sentences.english: For over seven years, we have detained hundreds of people at Guantánamo.
sentences.chinese: 過去7年多來，我們在關塔納摩灣拘押了數百人。

sentences.english: At present, they were held in Chiang Rai, the police will step up investigation.
sentences.chinese: 目前，他們被拘押於清萊，警方正將加緊調查。

definition: in custody/to keep sb in detention
on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
to detain/to take into custody/to imprison temporarily
to imprison/to jail/to take into custody
to send away under escort (criminals, goods etc)
